This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"upgradeTo(address)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. params.appCID_: The app cid of the deal
params.depositAmount_: The deposit amount of the deal
params.maxWorkersPerProvider_: The max workers per provider of the deal
params.minWorkers_: The min workers of the deal. Deel will be activated only if the number of workers is greater
params.paymentToken_: The payment token of the deal. User can choose any ERC20 token for payment
params.pricePerWorkerEpoch_: The price per worker per epoch of the deal
params.providersAccessList_: The providers access list of the deal
params.providersAccessType_: The providers access type of the deal (None, Whitelist, Blacklist)
params.targetWorkers_: The target workers of the deal. It's the max number of workers for the deal

hasDeal(address).details: Returns true if the deal exists

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.appCID_: The app cid of the deal
params.depositAmount_: The deposit amount of the deal
params.maxWorkersPerProvider_: The max workers per provider of the deal
params.minWorkers_: The min workers of the deal. Deel will be activated only if the number of workers is greater
params.paymentToken_: The payment token of the deal. User can choose any ERC20 token for payment
params.pricePerWorkerEpoch_: The price per worker per epoch of the deal
params.providersAccessList_: The providers access list of the deal
params.providersAccessType_: The providers access type of the deal (None, Whitelist, Blacklist)
params.targetWorkers_: The target workers of the deal. It's the max number of workers for the deal

It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

DealCreated(address,address,uint256,addr.details: Emitted when a new deal is created

params.paymentToken: The payment token of the deal. User can choose any ERC20 token for payment
